item.title: About
item.description: I’m a tech leader and software engineer who specializes in designing, munging, and shipping data. Currently I’m a principal data engineer for Trello at Atlassian. Previously, I was a U.S. federal civil servant, serving as a tech lead and member of the engineering team at 18F, a consultancy inside the General Services Administration. During my 18F tenure, I lead the technical implementation of the DATA Act, the nationâ€™s first open data law.

item.title: Projects
item.description: Talks 2018 StrangeLoop Software With a Mission: From Coder to Bureaucrat (co-presenter) 2018 FiveCollege Stats and Data Science Research Bytes: Columnar Data Storage and the Separation of Compute and Storage 2018 Western MA Full Stack Meetup: The Humble Dataframe 2017 DATA Act Summit: Leveraging Technology to Modernize Government (panel) 2017 DATA Act Training: Why the DATA Act Matters: New Uses for Standardized Spending Information 18F Tech Talk: Data Munging With Python and Pandas 2014 NERD Summit: Intro to IPython Notebooks 2012 Association of Public Data Users: Transitioning to Open Government Data Wharton Computing Tech Talk: Elegant and Efficient Database Design DATA Act: USAspending API Led the buildout of an API that presents, for the first time, a unified view of U.
